<h1>DSP Emulator v0.22 by Leniad 2001-2023</h1><br>
Well, this is just another emulator... but, where is the difference? This is a pascal open source emulator using Delphi/Lazarus environment. There aren't many emulators in pascal...<br>
Yes, its open source, you can compile it yourself. But you cannot use it for commercial purposes.<br>
There are versions available for Windows 32/64-bit, Linux 64-bit, and MacOS 64-bit.<br><br>
<b>1-. Emulator</b>
<hr>
- Can natively handle ZIP format. You can load ROMS, tapes, snapshots or disks from a ZIP files.<br>
- For any version the library SDL v2.X is needed.  For Windows you can download it from the same website of the emulator or from the official website 'www.libsdl.org'. If not present the emulator warns and can not start.<br>
- For Linux and MacOS you need SDL Mixer v2.X library too<br><br>
The emulator includes inside the ZIP (not in WIP versions) the ROMS for Spectrum 48K/128K/+3 (and variants), Amstrad CPC 464/664/6128, Commodore 64 and Coleco.<br><br>
<b>IS NOT ALLOWED DISTRIBUTE THIS EMULATOR WITH COPYRIGHTED ROMS</b><br><br>
<b>1.1-. Keys</b>
<hr>
-General Keys:<br><pre>
    F1 --> Service/Pause key
    F2 --> Full speed/Normal Speed
    F3 --> Reset machine
    F6 --> Full screen
    F7  --> Save quick Snapshot 1
    F8  --> Save quick Snapshot 2
    F9  --> Load quick Snapshot 1
    F10 --> Load quick Snapshot 2
    F11 --> Changes emulation speed from 25%, 50%, 75% and 100%</pre>
In some arcade drivers you can load/save two quick snapshots<br><br>
- Keys for both players are redefinable, and you can select an external joystick for any player and up to 6 buttons per player<br>
By default keys are<br><pre>
    Player 1 Up       --> Key 'Cursor UP'
    Player 1 Down     --> Key 'Cursor DOWN'
    Player 1 Left     --> Key 'Cursor LEFT'
    Player 1 Right    --> Key 'Cursor RIGHT'
    Player 1 Button 1 --> Key 'LEFT CONTROL'
    Player 1 Button 2 --> Key 'LEFT ALT'
    Start player 1    --> Key '1'
    Start player 2    --> Key '2'
    Insert coin 1     --> Key '5'
    Insert Coin 2     --> Key '6'</pre>
Any other control is not defined. You can redefine it in the main configuration menu.<br>
You can select autofire for all players buttons<br><br>
- Spectrum/Amstrad/C64 basic keys:<br><pre>
    F1 --> Play/Stop tape
    F4 --> Save snapshot
    F5 --> Remove Disk</pre><br>
<b>1.2-. Language Files</b>
<hr>
DSP is by default in English, if you want to change it using 'File -> Language' or click the Settings button.<br>
You can select 'Castellano', 'Catalan', 'English', 'German', 'French', 'Brazilian' or 'Italian'.<br><br>
<b>1.3-. Configuration</b>
<hr>
In the main screen of the emulator you can press some buttons<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Reset/Start/Pause emulation<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Fastest/Slow emulation<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- General configuration, you can configure some options<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Select the main language<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Sound: enabled or disabled<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Video settings: 1x, 2x, scanlines 1x, scanlines 2x or 3x factor<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Default directories for arcade ROMs (Supports multiple directories separated by semicolons), hiscore files, preview images, samples, quick snapshots and NV-Ram files<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Redefine all keys or use external joystick<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Load last driver/use driver list<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Show the ROMs CRC errors<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Center the main screen when the driver is changed<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Consoles: show game loading menu at startup<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Configuration of drivers can be changed as follows:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- When the running driver is an arcade, there is a button for change the dip switches<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- When the driver wich is running is a computer/console, there is a button to change its specific configuration<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Show game list:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- The emulator can start whith a list of drivers, which shows the arcade games, computers and consoles available and further information: availability of the ROMS for each system, distribution year, company, etc. In general configuration you can choose this way of booting (show a game list), or the old way (run the last driver loaded)<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Also when you open the game list, you can see a sort options on the window.
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Save Pictures: You can save GIF, JPG or PNG from all drivers (arcade, computer or console). The snapshot uses the same resolution that you choose in the video options, if 2x is selected, the snapshot doubles the picture resolution.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Export ROMs/samples information: You can export ROMs/samples information in .DAT (Clearmame) format to check if any is missing, defective, etc.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Autofire: You can configure autofire in any of the buttons of both players<br><br>
<b>2-. Drivers</b><br>
<hr>
<b>2.1 Computers</b><br>
<hr>
<br><b>Spectrum 16K, 48K, 128K, +2 and +2A/+3</b><br>
<hr>
- ROMS: You can change Spectrum ROM loading. Configure your favorite ROM or a ZIP file (the name of the ROM inside the ZIP must be the same of ZIP name, for example 'SPECTRUM.ZIP' and the ROM inside the ZIP 'SPECTRUM.ROM')<br>
- Border: You can choose line by line emulation, pixel by pixel emulation (slowly but more exact) or disable border emulation (fastest).<br>
- LensLok: The window showing the protection is automatically activated when detecting a tape/disc having this protection, also automatically selects the appropriate game. You can force the display/hide the LensLok protection window, also within the window you can select the game if is not detected correctly.<br>
- Spectrum 48K issue: Choose Spectrum issue 2 or 3<br>
- Joystick: emulated with the redefinable keys or external joystick. You can choose joystick type:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Kempston<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Cursor/Protek<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Sinclair 1/Interface 2<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Sinclair 2/Interface 2<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Fuller<br>
- Gunstick/Lightgun: The mouse is used as Gunstick, and left button is used as fire.<br>
- AMX Mouse/Kempston Mouse: Use the mouse and the buttons.<br>
- ULA+: Enable/disable ULA+ extended colors.<br>
- AY8912 sound: Set the type of channels sound: mono, stereo ABC or stereo ACB<br>
- Tape loading sound: Enable/disable the sound of the tape when loading.<br>
- Speaker filter: Enable/disable filter to reduce the noise in speaker emulation.<br>
- Speaker oversample: Quality of speaker emulation<br>
- Turbo Sound: Add a second AY-8912<br><br>
Other features<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Keyboard: Besides the standar keys mapped, there are some special keys:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Simbol Shift: Shift key (left or right)<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Caps Shift: Control key (left or right)<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Keys on extended models, mapped according to its function<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="pc_spectrum.jpg" width="25%" height="25%"></img><br>
- Virtual Tapes: Support 'TAP', 'TZX', 'PZX', 'WAV' and 'CSW' (Version 1 and 2), ZIP compressed or not. Fully working spectrum load schemes (bleepload, alkatraz, original rom...)<br>
&nbsp;With the mouse you can move inside virtual tape and select the start position. Tape begin to play when detects 'LOAD ""' command or you can press start/stop buttons on tape window. Tape stop when reaches the end of the tape and rewinds to the beginning.<br>
&nbsp;If inside the ZIP file there is a 'ROM' file, emulator load first ROM file and then loads then virtual tape.<br>
&nbsp;Also, if inside the ZIP is a 'SCR' image file, it's used as a preview.<br>
- Snapshots: you can load 'Z80', 'DSP', 'SNA', 'SZX', 'ZX' and 'SP'. And you can save in 'SZX', 'Z80', 'DSP' and 'SNA' formats.<br>
- Audio: Emulated beeper. On Spectrum 128K revisions there is an AY-8912.<br>
- Floppy disk: Emulated all NEC-765 functions but write operations. Supports 'IPF', 'DSK' and 'extended DSK' formats.<br>
- To do:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Contented IO is not working at 100%.<br><br>
<b>Amstrad CPC 464,664 and 6128</b><br>
<hr>
- ROMs: The following options exists:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- On CPC models 464 and 6128 you can choose the lower ROM corresponding to various regions (UK, French, Spanish or Danish), also on all models you can choose to load a low ROM different from the Amstrad original<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- There are 6 slots available to load additional ROMs<br>
- RAM: You can configure the following memory extensions:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Dk'tronics compatible: 512Kb of extra RAM<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Extension of 4Mb (not working)<br>
- LensLok: The window showing the protection is automatically activated when detecting a tape/disc having this protection, also automatically selects the appropriate game. You can force the display/hide the LensLok protection window, also within the window you can select the game if is not detected correctly.<br>
- Keyboard: Besides the standar keys mapped, there are some special keys:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- F0..F9 CPC function keys are emulated using the numbers on the PC keypad<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- The shift key on the CPC: Mapped on both shift keys (left or right) on the PC keyboard<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- The 'point' button next to the function in the CPC is also mapped into the 'point' PC keypad<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- The 'Enter' key on the numeric keypad PC works also as 'Enter' in the emulation CPC<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="pc_cpc.png" width="25%" height="25%"></img><br>
- Joystick: Emulated with the redefinable keys or external joystick.<br>
- Virtual Tape: support 'CDT', 'WAV' and 'CSW', ZIP compressed or not. Work the classical loading squemes (bleepload, alkatraz, SpeedLock ...)<br>
&nbsp;Use the mouse to move inside the virtual tape and select the starting position. Start/stop tape motor commands also start/stop tape.<br>
- Sound: All version support the AY-8912<br>
- Floppy disk: Emulated the functions of the NEC-765, just missing writing functions. Supports 'IPF', 'DSK' and 'extended DSK' formats.<br>
- Snapshots: Support load/save 'SNA' format<br>
- To do:<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Some disk protections are not working (a few left)<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Some video effect are missing (M6845 chip)<br><br>
<b>2.2 Consoles</b><br>
<hr>
<b>NES</b><br>
<hr>
- Cartridge: Supports 'NES' file format, ZIP compressed or not.<br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or external joystick<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'SELECT' uses coin 1 (by default is mapped as key '5')<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'START' uses start player 1 (by default is mapped as the '1' key).<br>
- Sound: Integrated sound chip support<br>
- Mappers: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, mmc6 ,7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 18, 21, 22, 23, 33, 34, 41, 42, 48, 57, 65, 66, 67, 68, 70, 71, 73, 75, 76, 79, 87, 88, 93, 94, 95, 113, 143, 145, 147, 148, 149, 150, 152, 154, 172, 180, 184, 185 and 243<br>
- Partial mappers: 5, 12, 32, 58, 64, 69, 85, 89, 105, 116, 132, 133, 137, 139, 142, 173, 206 and 212<br>
- To Do<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Add more mappers<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Video Timings<br><br>
<b>GameBoy/Gameboy Color</b><br>
<hr>
- ROMs: Not required, but if present are loaded and run as the original console.<br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or the external joystick<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'SELECT' uses coin 1 (by default is mapped as key '5')<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'START' uses start player 1 (by default is mapped as the '1' key).<br>
- Cartridges: Supports 'GB' and 'GBC' file format, ZIP compressed or not.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Mappers supported are MBC0, MBC1, MBC2, MBC3, MBC5 and HuC-1<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Partial Mapper: MBC7<br>
- To Do<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Audio problems, do not work fine with high frequencies<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Video Timings<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Add more mappers<br><br>
<b>ColecoVision</b><br>
<hr>
- ROM: The ROM is needed for emulation<br>
- Keys: Joystick is emulated with the redefinable keys or external joystick (the secondary joystick does not have keys assigned). Does not support (still) the special joysticks.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The numbers on the keyboard from '1' to '0' emulate the number keys.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Keys 'Q' and 'W' emulate the keys '*' and '#'<br>
- Cartridges: supports game cartridges with 'ROM' and 'COL' file extension, ZIP compressed or not<br>
- Sound: Support the sound SN-76496 chip<br>
- Snapshot: Load/save snapshots with my own format. When the snapshot is loaded includes the ROM cartridge, so they are independent and can be loaded without the original cartridge.<br>
- Support Super Game Card y Mega Cart<br><br>

<b>Chip 8/Super Chip8</b><br>
<hr>
- ROM: Does not have. It's a simulation of a pseudo CPU.<br>
- Keyboard: Mapped the system keys<br><pre>
    Original    Real Keyboard
    1 2 3 A     1 2 3 4
    4 5 6 B     Q W E R
    7 8 9 C     A S D F
    D 0 E F     Z X C V</pre>
- Sound: basic sound mono supported<br>
- Video: Supports 64x32 format from Chip8, 64x64 from Chip8 Hires and 128x64 from SuperChip8<br>
- Files: Supports 'CH8' y 'BIN' file format<br>
<b>Sega Master System</b><br>
<hr>
- ROM: It is required for emulation. Depending on the location of the console you can choose<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Europe/Australia PAL<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Japan/Korea NTSC<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- USA/Brazil NTSC<br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or the external joystick, support 2 players<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'SELECT' uses coin 1 (by default is mapped as key '5')<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'START' uses start player 1 (by default is mapped as the '1' key).<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'PAUSE' uses F1 key<br>
- Sound: Sound chip SN-76496 implemented<br>
- Cartridges: Supports 'SMS' file format, ZIP compressed or not.<br>
- Video: Supports all video special SMS video modes, and all the original. Supports NTSC and PAL.<br>
<b>SG-1000</b><br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or the external joystick, support 2 players<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'SELECT' uses coin 1 (by default is mapped as key '5')<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'START' uses start player 1 (by default is mapped as the '1' key).<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'PAUSE' uses F1 key<br>
- Sound: Sound chip SN-76496 implemented<br>
- Cartridges: Supports 'SG' file format, ZIP compressed or not.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Mappers: Supports up to tree types, with almost 100% compatibility<br>
<b>Game Gear</b><br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or the external joystick<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'SELECT' uses coin 1 (by default is mapped as key '5')<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- 'START' uses start player 1 (by default is mapped as the '1' key).<br>
- Sound: Sound chip SN-76496 implemented<br>
- Cartridges: Supports 'GG' file format, ZIP compressed or not.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Mappers: Supports two types, with almost 100% compatibility<br>
<b>Super Cassete Vision</b><br>
- Keys: Use the redefined keys or the external joystick for both joysticks<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The numbers on the keyboard from '1' to '0' emulate the number keys.<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key 'Q' emulates 'Cl'<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key 'W' emulates 'En'<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key 'P' emulates 'pause'<br>
- Sound: UPD-1771 emulated<br>
- Cartridges: Supports all known cartridges (some of them are bad dumps!)<br>
- To do<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- Enhance sound<br><br>
<b>Sega Genesis/Megadrive</b><br>
- Initial driver<br><br>
<b>2.3 Arcade</b><br>
<hr>
<b>2.3.1 Samples</b><hr>
Some games, given the difficulty of emulating old sound systems, uses 'samples'. Such files are portions of digitized sound, played instead of emulating the sound system.<br>
Currently only some drivers use wholly or partly this system.<br>
If you want the emulator to use the samples, put the compressed sample files with the same name as the ROM in a folder named 'samples'.<br>
You can download all the samples from the emulator page<br>
Look at the arcade systems list to know which systems use samples.<br><br>

<b>3-. Contribute/Code distribution</b><br>
<hr>
If you want to add another language, download old languaje files and edit any file with the extension '.lng', rename it with the language name and send it to me, to add it to the next version.<br>
If you make any improvements to any driver, processor, main code, etc. or add drivers, please send the changes to me, so they can be added to the main code.<br>
If you use part of the code of the emulator for any <b>non commercial purpose</b>, you only need to add in the documentation/source something like 'Z80 core written by Leniad'. And please send me a email to see the written program. :-)<br><br>
<b>4-. Acknowledgments</b><br>
<hr>
- First, of course, the MAME team. Without them, this emulator never had existed, thanks to distribute the source code to help many people, people like me. (And of course the 'MAME guru' Nicola Salmoria).<br>
- Chris Cowley, author of VBSpec, from where I've pick a lot of information about Spectrum. In addition I've also got the part of the AY-3-8912 of its emulator, which is an excellent conversion that comes with MAME.<br>
- Raul Gomez Sanchez author of the R80, one of the best Spectrum emulators for DOS, which use your debugger to trace errors in my emulator Z80.<br>
- World of Spectrum, they have many tapes, snapshots, in addition many technical information, including the format TZX, DSK, Z80, etc.<br>
- javi[@]fsmail.net that helped me in a moment of desperation with directSound.<br>
- Michael Franzen, who sent me drivers for Pooyan, Coleco, System1, Chip8 and many others to be included in DSP.<br>
- Tom Walker, he sent me his driver CPS1 where I got and understood a lot of information.<br>
- sremulador, for begin the rewriting of NES driver<br>
- Martijn, from Revival Studios for the info about Chip8<br>
- greatxerox, for his time and emulation tests on the CPC (and other bugs)<br>
- Thanks to Bruno Kukulcan and Megachur for some Amstrad CPC IPF files for testing<br>
- Thanks to Neville for general bug discover, tests and preview images<br>
- And many pages from Internet, many documents ... and people who I forget, thank you all.<br><br>
<b>5-. Copyright</b><br>
<hr>
- The Coleco and Pooyan has been rewrited from the originals by Michael Franzen.<br>
- The CPS1 has been rewrited from the original by Tomas Walker.<br>
- The source code for the Lensloc protection simulation comes from Simon Owen.<br>
- All the drivers, the Z80 core, M6502 core, M6809 (HD6309) core, M68000 core, M680X core, TMS-32010 core, NEC v20/v30/v33 core, LR35902 core, M6805 core, MCS51 core,Hu6280 core and MB88XX core are writed by me, Leniad.<br>
- AY-3-891X emulator is a conversion from Chris Cowley, but the original emulator come from MAME team.<br>
- SN76496, YM2203, TMS36XX, VLM-5030, YM3812/YM3526, YM2151, i8255, OKI6295, UPD7759, Z80PIO, Z80CTC, NES sound emulator, pokey and Sega VDP emulators are a conversion writed by me from MAME original.<br>
- TMS99XX emulator have been rewrited from the original by Michael Franzen and have parts from MAME.<br>
- NEC765 emulator is a conversion writed and adapted by me, from MESS original.<br>
All Spectrum, CPC464, CPC664 and CPC6128 roms are copyright of Amstrad.<br><br>
